content.description: Sit start back in the roof on large, sharp underclings.  Toe hook and utilize a crimpy sidepull to go again to a sloper over the lip.  Other hand on a crimp over the lip, then go for the jug to an easy mantel.  Used to be considered V hard but the discovery of new beta (toe hook) has made it more reasonable.  Tony's Roof is one of the steepest problems in all of Gretna.
content.protection: Single pad, might help if it is thin.
content.location: This problem ascends the obvious 70 degree roof along the trail 100 feet from the Smiley Boulder.

content.description: Start matched on a crimp seam all the way to the right of the boulder. Move left and up on the slopers, crimps and seams all the way until you round the corner to the crimps and side-pulls on the arete and mantle up using the big ledge as foot.
content.protection: Multiple pads, its a long traverse
content.location: past soul assassin, keep moving right towards a small trail that goes down and you should arrive from behind the boulder towards the left side of the arete.

content.description: Start low with bad feet, good left sidepull and poor right hand crimp. Go big up to sloper, and fight your way to the top.

The single most obvious dyno at Gretna. Start on massive horn with a perfectly placed foot hold. Hit the gritty sloper. Hold--maybe cut feet. Grab onto the multitude of jugs up there.

 Crux: Top-out. Muscle-up, gripping--ripping--hooking on either the left or right side of the roof.

 V8 in the guidebook--difficulty varies vastly with bodytype/strengths.
content.protection: Two Pads, Dyno can get messy, and failed top-outs are dicey. Watch out for the left wall.
content.location: Left of The Outlier (v6). Past tony's roof via the left trail, up--up to see obvious horn.

content.description: Sit start matched on a obvious jug and pick some feet. Pull on and cross right hand to a sloper crimp, then work your way left to the arete. Figure out how to reach the crimp way out left from the mediocre holds of the arete. Once established on the crimp toss up and top out on jugs.
content.location: Follow the faint path left around the back of 'Tony's Roof" and this is the odd shaped, less than appealing looking boulder. It climbs way way better than it looks,

content.description: s.d.s. with a left hand side pull and a seam for your right. move straight up to crimps and then follow the seam out right. top out as you would for "tony's roof".
content.protection: 2 pads or one pad and a spotter to slide it along.
content.location: same boulder as "tony's roof". starts on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Routes that don't have boulder pages yet.
